title: Full Moon
summary: A point of visibility and culmination that highlights what has surfaced, inviting integration or release without forcing outcomes.

meaning.headline: What was seeded is now visible—notice, integrate, and choose what to release.

frames.text: The Full Moon brings things into view so you can acknowledge results and feelings.
It’s a good time to notice what’s peaked and decide what to keep or let go.
This guarantees dramatic events or conflict.

frictions: Overreacting to heightened emotion or spotlight
Treating visibility as pressure to decide everything
Holding onto what has run its course
opportunities: Name what has come to fruition
Release what no longer needs your energy

do: Acknowledge what’s now obvious—even small wins or lessons.
Choose one thing to release or simplify.
Share feelings or outcomes plainly rather than escalating.
avoid: Making sweeping declarations out of urgency
Ignoring what is clearly asking for closure

reusable_lines.text: What’s surfaced is ready to be seen and integrated.
You can let go of what’s peaked and refocus your energy.

forbidden_claims: Making identity claims based on the Full Moon
allowed_framing: Observational: “more is visible; you can respond to what’s in the light.”
Agency-forward: “choose what to keep and what to release.”
Non-deterministic: “heightened feelings can inform your next move.”
